It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring intricate petal arrangements and vibrant coloration that attract specific pollinators. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments, often found in cloud forests or mountainous areas with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Lacmellea standleyi is considered a vulnerable species in conservation efforts.
